creator: hermod.opstvedt@dnb.no
text:
SocketAppender throws a full stacktrace during initialization, i a listener is 
not available. Consider catching the java.net.ConnectException, and only give a 
simple message using loglog as is done with IOException

I wish it didn't do that if you set the ReconnectionDelay to zero.  See Ceki's
comments at the end of bug 15599

When log4j begins to use itself instead of LogLog for internal logging it would
be possible to set the logger so you don't see it.

I've got a workaround QuietSocketAppender class, see: bug 17260
creator: scott@schram.net

text: Now in log4j 1.3, log4j is using itself for internal logging.
